Anki Text File Import — Quick Reference What files and encoding - Plain text files (.txt). If you have other formats, save as plain text first. - UTF-8 encoding required. Structure and fields - Anki uses the first non-comment line to determine the number of fields. - If later records have fewer fields, missing fields are blank; extra fields are ignored. - Records are separated by the chosen field delimiter (comma, semicolon, tab, etc.). You can change the delimiter in import options or force it with headers. Headers (top of the file) - You can add #key:value lines to control import: - separator: , or ; or tab or space or | etc. - html: true or false (treat as HTML) - tags: space-separated tags added to every note - columns: names of columns (for display) - notetype: default note type (name or id) - deck: default deck (name or id) - notetype column: 1,2,3… (column containing per-row note type) - deck column: 1,2,3… (column containing per-row deck) - tags column: 1,2,3… (column containing per-row tags) - guid column: 1,2,3… (column containing per-row GUID) Mapping and notes - Fields in the text map to note fields; you can reassign mapping during import. - You can map a field to the tags field. Decks and duplicates - During import you choose which deck notes go to; if a template has a deck override, that deck may be used instead. - Duplicates: first field is used for uniqueness. - If a matching note of the same type exists, you can update it or import as new (configurable). - match scope determines duplicate checks: by note type only, or by note type and deck. - If updating in place, existing scheduling remains. Notes on content and formatting - Quotes and multiline fields: - Enclose field content in quotes to include newlines or separators. - To include a literal quote inside a quoted field, double the quote: "". - HTML in fields: - Enable Allow HTML in fields to use HTML formatting in text. - If using HTML, you can replace special characters with HTML entities (< as <, > as >, & as &). - HTML newlines in fields: - Use
for a line break; ensure HTML is allowed. - Escaped multiline may not work with cloze deletions spanning lines; prefer HTML line breaks in that case. - Including media references in text: - Put media files in collection.media (no subfolders). - Reference with or [sound:filename.mp3]. - Use find/replace to convert placeholders to [sound:\1.mp3] if needed (regex enabled). - Enable Allow HTML for media markup to work. - Do not embed media via templates (e.g., {{field}}) for this purpose. Bulk media - The media import add-on can create notes from files in a folder (front = filename without extension; back = media). Spreadsheets and UTF-8 - For non-Latin characters, save as UTF-8. - LibreOffice is recommended for UTF-8 CSV export (File > Save As > CSV). Excel exports can be problematic. Notes on GUIDs and updates - GUIDs are globally unique identifiers; if provided and already exist, duplicates are not created. - If you supply your own IDs, you can place them in the first field instead of the internal GUID. - When a GUID is present, the duplicate option may not apply as usual. Simple example - "apple;banana;grape" - Comment line: "# this is ignored" - field1;field2;field3 Quick example with per-row note type and deck (via headers) - #separator:; - #notetype: Basic - #deck: MyDeck - apple; banana; grape Sample with tags and HTML - notetype: Basic - deck: MyDeck - hello world; tag1 tag2; [sound:click.mp3] This concise reference covers: file requirements, encoding, structure, headers, mapping, dealing with quotes and HTML, media handling, bulk media, duplicates, GUIDs, and a tiny example.
